alert.note: Alert for Badlands Area; Bennett County Area; Central Black Hills; Custer County Plains; Eastern Foot Hills; Fall River County Area; Haakon County Area; Mellette and Todd Counties; Pine Ridge Area; Southern Black Hills; West Central Plains (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 04 at 2:41AM MDT until April 04 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MDT /NOON CDT/ THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MDT /9 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, 317, 318, 319, 320, 321, 322, 323, 324, 325, 326, 329, 331, 332, 333, 334, AND 335... .Warm, very dry, and breezy to windy conditions will develop across much of northeast Wyoming and western South Dakota late this morning through the afternoon. Relative humidities will fall as low as 10 percent, with south to southwest wind gusts over 40 mph, producing critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MDT /NOON CDT/ THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MDT /9 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, 317, 320, 321, 322, 324, 325, 326, 329, 331, 332, 333, AND 334... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 314 Northern Campbell, 315 Southern Campbell, 316 Crook County Plains, 317 Weston County Plains, 320 Central Black Hills, 321 Southern Black Hills, 322 Fall River County Area, 324 Eastern Foot Hills, 325 Custer County Plains, 326 Pine Ridge Area, 329 West Central Plains, 331 Haakon County Area, 332 Badlands Area, 333 Bennett County Area and 334 Mellette and Todd Counties. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity will produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Badlands Area; Bennett County Area; Central Black Hills; Custer County Plains; Eastern Foot Hills; Fall River County Area; Haakon County Area; Mellette and Todd Counties; Pine Ridge Area; Southern Black Hills; West Central Plains
